solution.text:
Volume of the cylindrical tank \(\pi \times R^2 \times h=\frac {22}7 \times _{{5*j}}_^2 \times _{{10*j}}_\)
Now given Flow speed \(v= _{j}_\)cm per second and radius of the pipe(r)\(=\frac d2 =\frac {_{{2*j}}_}2= _{j}_\)cm
\(\Rightarrow\) volume of water flowing through the pipe per second\(=\pi \times r^2 \times v\)
let the time required to fill the tank be t sec
Amount of water flowing in t sec=\(\pi \times r^2 \times v\times t\)
equating the water flowing out of the pipe to the capacity of the tank we get
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times _{{5*j}}_^2 \times _{{10*j}}_=\pi \times _{j}_^2 \times _{j}_\times t\)
\(\Rightarrow t= 250\,seconds\)

content.text:
Raghu connects a pipe of diameter _{{2*j}}_cm to a cylindrical tank of height _{{10*j}}_cm and radius(R) _{{5*j}}_cm
If water flows through the pipe at a speed of _{j}_cm per second, find the time taken to fill the tank completely.
